rComments: Doesnt post lecture slides or details on assignments. Details of assignments are vague and personally this is why I did bad in the course. Being a d level course, it should have better organization and marking scheme. Tests were marked pretty hard.

Cochrane is a very good professor. He does tend to go off topic sometimes but he explains class content very well. His tests are not very difficult, as long as you take good notes and pay attention in lecture, you should get at least a B- in this class. He gives very clear instructions about what to study for on tests, so there are no surprises.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Both courses I took with him were well organized and his lectures followed the syllabus. The lectures related to the readings so do them before class, but he also explains all the main points during lectures very clearly. Had him as a prof for a big class and a small class and he was excellent in both settings.

He is no doubt one of the best profs at U of T.  As long as you take advantage of every opportunity that he gives you (I.e. The In-Course Essay Support and choosing Option A in both semesters in terms of assessment) then you are guaranteed to do well in his class! He is very approachable, understanding, and makes Canadian politics very interesting!

Definitely the best prof i have ever had! First prof that made me love going to class. Amazing at explaining things and is always willing to further explain to students who are still confused. He never makes you feel dumb for asking questions, and is always so nice and ready to help. Also, he has a great sense of humour. Amazing guy

His anecdotes really bring a unique perspective to his classes. He's very funny and very laid back. Not quick to answer his email but he does answer over facebook rather quickly. I've had him twice and I feel my marks were fair. His fourth year course requires a good degree of participation but he makes it easy to contribute.

Like others have mentioned, Cohrane is a good guy but his marking scheme is unfair, especially left in the hands of the TA's which mark way too hard for a B-level course. Def would not recommend this unless you need the credit.

Although Professor Cochrane is clearly passionate about the subject area and the lectures are enjoyable, the tests do not reflect the content of the course, as students are expected to know information beyond the lectures and textbooks for an A grade... A bit arbitrary. There's also a disconnect in the way the TAs mark, which is super frustrating.

Cochrane is a great guy but he has been experimenting with the course structure and the outcome has been disastrous for my grades. lecture are useless and so is the readings, don't bother buying the textbook. some TA's mark way harder than others, and if Cochrane marks your work- GOOD LUCK. Seriously considered dropping this
One of the best , if not the best, profs at U of T. Accommodating, helpful, knowledgeable and respectful. I would highly recommend taking any course that is taught by Chris Cochrane.
He's the best prof I had at UofT. Got a B-, but that's my fault. Enjoyable class
Wonderful teacher, approachable, respectable and kind.

Chris is a great man, one on one talking about Can politics, but as a professor he is not good whatsoever. His grading criteria appears clear, but if you follow it exactly and do even more beyond it, you will still end up with a 70. He and his TAs are on total different pages about grading. Poor class & prof overall.

The course in itself is boring, unless youre into Can. Politics. However, he doesn't make the class boring. He's a really good lecturer, always clarifies and answers questions to help students better understand material. Guest lecturers were great. Assignments weren't too hard as well. Keep up w. lectures + readings and you can get a good grade.

Good prof, very helpful with clarifying and helping students understand material better. Exams and assignments were not super hard, but attending class and reading the course material is important to better understand important concepts/themes. TAs were good too. He was really engaging to make the class more interesting.

Amazingly captivating professor. Never had an interest in Canadian politics, but he made me want to go to every lecture. His slides are well-organized and the way he talks about his material is both well-informed and engaging. His assignments can be hard to follow sometimes, but they develop crucial research and writing skills

Amazing proff. I hate poli-sci before coming to his class. He explains concepts very clear and is very helpful if you dont understand anything. His exams are fair. He tries to give you an outline before the final. Does not try to trick you in anyway. Assignments were fairly moderate, so make sure to put in effort.

He is funny and the exams and assignments were really fair. No suprises. My TA, Andrew was was really enthusiastic and knew what he was talking about. We also had a few well respected guest speakers come in which was cool. The course material isn't exactly stimulating but I think the faculty did a great job of teaching the course
Cochrane is an amazing professor. He cares about his students and love that he makes his TAs provide constructive feedback on assignments
I'll be blunt. Anybody that can portray Canadian Politics in an interesting and engaging manner that actually creates a real passion within his students deserves some kind of medal.

Professors like him should be more in universities and colleges. No one should miss his lectures. Always helpful, friendly and will give you time whenever you need it. Believe me guys he is one of my favourite professors.
